title: Bug 110566: Wrong data set result returned when setting an invalid filter expression row[0]
description: When setting a filter expression like 'row[0] equals to 0', the result set is returned incorrectly or null.
OB: When setting a filter expression 'row[0] equals to 0' and clicking on the Preview tab, the first record of the result set is returned.
EB: The expected behavior is that row[0] should not be used as a filter expression since it can only be generated after fetching all the data. Therefore, the result set should not be affected by invalid filter expressions using row[0].
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Set a filter in the data set with the expression 'row[0] equals to 0'. 
2. Click on the Preview tab and observe the returned result.
